title: How To Make Fufu In USA: Modern Techniques - Nigerian Cassava Fufu
p1: The first time I had fufu I felt robbed.  I would have grown up eating this amazing swallow, but for the Trans African Ocean Trade in Africans. My first bite into fufu was that powerful. I want you to experience this too.
p2: Fufu (or fufuo, foofoo, foufou) is a dough-like food found in West African cuisine. In addition to Ghana, it is also found in Sierra Leone, Guinea, Liberia, Cote D'Ivoire, Benin, Togo, Nigeria, Cameroon, the Democratic Republic of Congo, the Central African Republic, the Republic of Congo, Angola and Gabon.
p3: It is often made in the traditional Ghanaian, Ivorian, Liberian, and Cuban method of separately mixing and pounding equal portions of boiled cassava with green plantain or cocoyam, or by mixing cassava/plantains or cocoyam flour with water and stirring it on a stove.
p4: A modern method of making fufu is to chop then blend the raw cassava and other ingredients then cook on a stove in water. The viscosity is then adjusted based on personal preference and eaten with broth-like soups. Some countries, particularly Nigeria, have a version of fufu made from fermented Cassava dough (called akpu by Nigerians) that is eaten with thick textured stews. Other flours, such as semolina, maize flour, or mashed plantains may take the place of cassava flour.
p5: Fufu is traditionally eaten with the fingers, and a small ball of it can be dipped into an accompanying soup or sauce.

content.h2: What are the health benefits of Cassava Fufu?

paragraphs.p: Cassava is a superfood. Superfoods are foods with exceptional nutrient density.
paragraphs.p1: Cassava is high in vitamin C, riboflavin, thiamine and niacin. The leaves are edible when they're cooked or dried out in the sun; they contain up to 25% protein too.
paragraphs.p2: Cassava has high levels of resistant starch that assists in building good gut bacteria. As a result, these healthy starches can pass through the digestive system without being broken down by enzymes.

li2.h2: Can pregnant women eat Cassava Fufu?

paragraphs.p: Absolutely! When taken in moderation fufu is safe to eat during pregnancy.

paragraphs.p: I like to sometimes add blended white onions to my fufu right before its done cooking. This comes from my time in Venezuela where raw onions are cubed and mixed into cooked cassava. With fufu, the trick is to put the onions into the fufu as late as possible to preserve the uncooked flavor as much as you can. The resulting flavor is to die for!

paragraphs.p: Fufu is eaten by breaking off a peice with the hand, rolling it into a ball, and dipping it into a sauce, stew or soup. Fufu is never chewed. It must be swallowed. This is not negotiable.
